unnormalised: Okay, here's the Quora post as requested, with a humorous tone and unnormalized medical data points:
normalised: Okay, so my “friend,” let’s call her Priya, is having a bit of a moment. She’s been going to Doctor Mehra, a gyno at Cloudnine Hospital, and everything’s been…interesting. Apparently, the world of Obstetrics and Gynecology is way more than just waiting for 'the call' (you know which one!). Priya recently went in for a check-up, and the doc was all like, "Your H-B levels are at ten point five grams per deciliter; we might need to consider iron supplements.” Priya, bless her heart, thought H-B was some kind of trendy new handbag brand. Sigh.

unnormalised: Subject: So, you're telling me *this* is what being a woman is all about? (Asking for a friend...sort of)
normalised: The doc then started talking about ultrasounds and N-S-T-s and things that sound like they belong in a sci-fi movie, not a lady’s insides. Apparently, a routine ultrasound costs rupee three thousand at the clinic, and that's just the beginning. She mentioned something about pre-eclampsia and gestational diabetes, which sounded scarier than trying to parallel park an auto-rickshaw in Mumbai during rush hour. She even used the acronym "P-C-O-S" like it was a common household term! My friend was practically hyperventilating.

unnormalised: Okay, so my “friend,” let’s call her Priya, is having a bit of a moment. She’s been going to Dr. Mehra, a gyno at Cloudnine Hospital, and everything’s been…interesting. Apparently, the world of Obstetrics and Gynecology is way more than just waiting for 'the call' (you know which one!). Priya recently went in for a check-up, and the doc was all like, "Your Hb levels are at 10.5 g/dL; we might need to consider iron supplements.” Priya, bless her heart, thought Hb was some kind of trendy new handbag brand. Sigh.
normalised: And the sheer number of appointments! Doctor Mehra wants to see her every two weeks after the twenty eighth week of pregnancy. Every two weeks? That’s more face time than she gets with her own mother! At this rate, she jokes she'll know the receptionist at the hospital better than her own spouse. Don't even get me started on the childbirth class pamphlet. It’s longer than a Bollywood movie and has more acronyms than a tech conference. Someone send help (and maybe chocolate).

unnormalised: The doc then started talking about ultrasounds and NSTs and things that sound like they belong in a sci-fi movie, not a lady’s insides. Apparently, a routine ultrasound costs Rs. 3000 at the clinic, and that's just the beginning. She mentioned something about pre-eclampsia and gestational diabetes, which sounded scarier than trying to parallel park an auto-rickshaw in Mumbai during rush hour. She even used the acronym "PCOS" like it was a common household term! My friend was practically hyperventilating.
normalised: Seriously though, is this what adulting as a woman is? Constant poking, prodding, and decoding medical jargon? My "friend" is half convinced they’re speaking another language entirely. She keeps googling all these terms - like, what is an amniocentesis, anyway? It's enough to make you want to curl up in a fetal position and never leave the house. And apparently, the joy only starts with the pregnancy. I hear postpartum is a whole other level of…adventure.

unnormalised: And the sheer *number* of appointments! Dr. Mehra wants to see her every 2 weeks after the 28th week of pregnancy. Every *two* weeks? That’s more face time than she gets with her own mother! At this rate, she jokes she'll know the receptionist at the hospital better than her own spouse. Don't even get me started on the childbirth class pamphlet. It’s longer than a Bollywood movie and has more acronyms than a tech conference. Someone send help (and maybe chocolate).
normalised: Anyway, any tips for navigating this whole Obstetrics and Gynecology jungle? Especially for someone who thinks "Pap smear" is a new type of fruit? My "friend" would be eternally grateful. And maybe send wine. (Non-alcoholic, of course, since, ya know, "friend".)

unnormalised: Seriously though, is this what adulting as a woman is? Constant poking, prodding, and decoding medical jargon? My "friend" is half convinced they’re speaking another language entirely. She keeps googling all these terms - like, what *is* an amniocentesis, anyway? It's enough to make you want to curl up in a fetal position and never leave the house. And apparently, the joy only *starts* with the pregnancy. I hear postpartum is a whole other level of…adventure.

Anyway, any tips for navigating this whole Obstetrics and Gynecology jungle? Especially for someone who thinks "Pap smear" is a new type of fruit? My "friend" would be eternally grateful. And maybe send wine. (Non-alcoholic, of course, since, ya know, "friend".)
